#Text=Pappenheimer family
#Text=The Pappenheimer family was tried and executed for witchcraft in 1600 in Bavaria , Germany .
#Text=The case is taken as an example of the torture used in witch trials , as it is unusually well documented .
#Text=Background
#Text=The Pappenheimers consisted of father Paulus , mother Anna , sons Jacob ( sometimes called Michel ) and Gumpprecht , and the youngest son , ten-year-old Hoel ( sometimes called Hansel ) .
#Text=They belonged to the lower class in German society , and were originally beggars from Swabia .
#Text=Pappenheimer was a nickname , their actual family name was P채mb or G채mperle .
#Text=Witch trial

#Text=They were pointed out by an arrested thief , and arrested in the middle of the night , taken from their beds and taken to jail , accused of having assisted the thief in murdering pregnant women for the purpose of making candles out of their unbaptized fetuses .
#Text=On the order of the duke Maximilian I ( Elector of Bavaria ) , they were taken to Munich , and exposed to torture so fierce they confessed to anything they were accused of or questioned about .
#Text=They were made responsible for every unsolved crime that had occurred in Bavaria in the later years and confessed to hundreds of thefts and murders .
#Text=They admitted sorcery and pointed out over four hundred accomplices .
#Text=Execution
#Text=The parents and the eldest sons were to be executed together with two other men .

#Text=The bodies of the men were torn six times each with irons , Anna 's breasts were cut off and rubbed in the faces of her adult sons , the skeletons of the men were broken on the wheel , the father was subjected to impalement on a pike , and finally , they were burned at the stake .

#Text=All this took place in front of the youngest son , ten-year-old Hoel , who was to witness the execution of his family ; he had been brought along on the horse of the sheriff , who was to write down his reactions .
#Text=Later the same year , in December 1600 , six more people were burned at the stake in M체nich , including Hoel .
#Text=Accounts

#Text=The historian Joseph Hormayr , Baron zu Hortenburg provides a detailed excerpt from an old chronicle depicting these events in the 1844 edition of Taschenbuch f체r die vaterl채ndische Geschichte , pages 331-332.
#Text=In M체nich 29 . July 1600 , six persons were executed in the following manner :
#Text=The vagabond and beggar Paul G채mperl was impaled , his wife had her breasts cut off , and both herself and two of her sons had those breasts smeared onto their mouths .
#Text=In addition , two other men and associates were executed , and all six were pinched with glowing pincers .
#Text=Their arms were broken on the wheel , and they were afterwards burnt alive .

#Text=They had confessed to being devoted to the Devil , and with his help , in particular by making a devilish , magic salve , to have contributed to the deaths of at least 400 children and more than 50 old people by having applied that salve .
#Text=Paul G채mperl was condemned for being directly responsible for 44 murders ; in total , the six were condemned for 74 murders .
#Text=In addition , they had been charged with many acts of robbery , theft and nightly burglaries , where they had plundered houses and killed the people in the houses .
#Text=They had also , according to the charges , put on fire diverse hamlets and marketplaces , principally in order to get away with goods in the ensuing confusion .
#Text=Also , they had conjured up bad weather , killed cows in the field , robbed churches and sold to the Jews the holy wafers .
#Text=The 27 .
#Text=November 1600 was the next batch of the gang executed .
#Text=This was a mother and her two daughter , as well as two other men .
#Text=The last to be executed was the 12-year-old son of Paul G채mperl , who in the intervening time had been baptized and given the name Cyprian .
#Text=However , that did not help him , he was first strangled , and then his corpse was burned .
#Text=The other 5 were burnt alive .
#Text=Cyprian was condemned for having performed 8 murders on his own .

#Text=The members of the whole group had , under torture , admitted to having contributed to the deaths of over 400 children , having killed , by means of sorcery , 39 individuals , and admitted 62 murders besides . [ 1 ]

#Text=Some divergences , such as Anna G채mperl having died prior to being burnt , rather than burning alive in the Hormayr account , in the chronicle used by Hormayr can be seen relative to an English account of the trial already in 1601 ( translated from a Dutch copy of the German original ) , A Strange Report of Sixe most notorious Witches [ 2 ]
